intro: Micromeria insularis, commonly known as the island micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the Galápagos Islands. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and delicate, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, adapting to the unique environmental conditions of its island home. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
